title: Conservation of angular momentum - child platform

content.question: A child is standing near the edge of a rotating platform, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The child-platform system is freely rotating with negligible friction around a central axle. The child then slowly walks directly to the center of the platform, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly states the change, if any, of the angular speed of the platform as the child walks to the center of the platform?

choices.label: The angular speed does not change.
The angular speed decreases to zero.
The angular speed decreases but remains greater than zero.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
